page.title: 12Recreation.
page.content: The Kennels of the Teme Valley Hunt have been here for about twenty years. Fifty seven dogs are housed here. English, Welsh and Fell Hounds are the breeds favoured. The puppies are "walked" with local farmers. Run by one family, the dogs hunt the Teme Valley Hunt twice a week during the Winter months.The hunt itself is over one hundred and fifty years old. The Long Distance Footpath _ Offa's Dyke crosses south east corner of the area. The country_side iis transversed by many footpaths. It is good walking country with many fine veiws of both the English and the Welsh countryside.This part of the country is well used by walkers. An added attraction is the abundance of wild flowers. Many birds nest in the area including Buzzards.
